definitions.definition: To offer a view (of something) from a higher position.
examples: Our hotel room overlooks the lake.

definitions.definition: To fail to notice ; to look over and beyond (anything) without seeing it.
examples: These errors were overlooked by the proofreaders.

definitions.definition: To pretend not to have noticed (something, especially a mistake or flaw ); to pass over (something) without censure or punishment.
examples: I’m not willing to overlook such bad behaviour.

definitions.definition: To look down upon from above or from a higher location.
To supervise , oversee ; to watch over .
examples: to overlook a gang of laborers
to overlook one who is writing a letter

definitions.definition: To observe or watch (someone or something) surreptitiously or secretly .
To inspect (something); to examine; to look over carefully or repeatedly.
To look upon with an evil eye ; to bewitch by looking upon; to fascinate.

main_definition: To offer a view (of something) from a higher position.
